turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Captain, you know, I really appreciate you hauling us a thousand feet below sea level so we can watch this historical event on television.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Nobody goes inside, until we know <u>what's</u> inside.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I'd also like it noted --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Duly noted, Ted.  Edmunds, try using suction.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What <u>about</u> a crowbar?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What if we go out there, you know -- wedge a crowbar in the door and pry the thing open.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ted, get her away from the door.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What are you going to do -- shoot her?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Look at this.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Some sort of lead or something.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Radiation shield, you think?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: A foot and a half thick?  That'd withstand a helluva lot of radiation.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What do you make of this?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We had considered it.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Considered what?  That it's American? How would you think it's American?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Time travel.  I always thought it was one of those myths... like Santa's reindeer.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What would we be working on in the future that would make us want to come back?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Maybe we didn't want to come back.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: But what does it do?  This... sphere.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Maybe it's a message of some sort, you know?  See this red here.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Can I stay, sir?  I'm willing to risk it.  I am.  After what we just witnessed.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What?  No, I know they're civilians...

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Did you hear me, sir, because --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ted, shut up.  Are you packed?  Ready to go?  I want everyone packed.  Now!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: How can he be missing?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Sir, about leaving --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We're on the bottom of the fucking ocean -- he can't just walk outside!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: They switched us over.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: To what?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Internal power.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: She says jellyfish are a delicacy. You know, I never knew that.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Get out of there.  I don't want anyone going anywhere outside, understood?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: From the sphere?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What's inside the sphere.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I want a name.  A real name.  This thing's full name, rank and serial number.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Captain, I personally feel we should ask much more substantive questions --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I am not gonna explain in some damn report that one person died in a deepsat expedition so we could meet an alien named Jerry.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It's not talking, it's mimicking.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Give him a chance.  He's speaking our language, not the other way around.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Edmunds?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Don't make stuff up, these emotional theories, just so you can feel important here.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The sensors are picking up something outside.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It won't register.  It's too big to image.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Too big?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well, until we know exactly what it is, nobody goes outside, understood?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What was Edmunds doing outside?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Resetting the sub.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What sub?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: In the dome hanger.  All our tapes are transferred to the sub.  It's on a 12 hour timer.  If someone doesn't reset the "delay" button, the sub ascends to the surface with the tapes.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth, look, can I trust you with a little secret?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I love secrets.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That ULF report everybody's patting me on the back about?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I've read it twice, Norman.  It's brilliant.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's bullshit.  The report's a joke.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: That's quite a secret.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I spent a week reading Sagan and watching re-runs of the Twilight Zone.  Seriously.  I was just trying to pay the mortgage on my house -- I had no idea --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Do yourself a favor, Norman.  Are you listening?  Don't tell anyone what you just told me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: C'mon, Beth -- that report's like the blind leading the blind.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Because when we get down there --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wait -- down where?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: To the spacecraft.  To investigate.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Underwater?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What do you expect?  For them to bring it up here?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We can't go down there.  We're not prepared.  That deep?  That takes years of training, Beth.  We're just scientists.  Lab scietists.  We wear ties and lab coats to work -- not oxygen tanks.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Well, you must have realized the chances an encounter like this would happen here.  In the ocean.  70 percent of the earth's surface is water, Norman.  That's first grade geography.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It never occurred to me.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Well, let's pray that's the only mistake you made.  Have you said anything to Barnes about this?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The timing has never seemed quite right.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Just keep your mouth shut, alright? This could mean everything to our careers, you know that?  Don't jeopardize this.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What -- are you threatening me?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Isn't there a psychological term for that, Dr. Johnson?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Drowning.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You're next, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No.  Go ahead.  Really.  Ladies first.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Such a gentlemen when you're scared shitless.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: 400 years ago?  I'm sure Christopher Columbus would've loved these accomodations.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Good theory, Ted.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Norman!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Get this thing off me.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It could breathe in air and exhale cyanide gas.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Disrupt our brain waves, interfere with our ability to think.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Where'd this come from?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: The library.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We have a library?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: A bad one.  It was the only book in there.  Norman, come here, look at this.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No, thank you.  I hate jellyfish.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: ... when I was six, my younger brother and I -- we went swimming in the Pacific.  At my mother's beach house.  We both felt stinging, and when we came out of the water, he was wearing jellyfish head to toe. Killed him.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: My gosh, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yeah, it was awful.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What about you?  What happened to you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Me?  Well, I was wrapped in seaweed. It itched for a while, but I survived.  Beth, do you find it... curious that we're seeing all this life down here.  Nothing, and then these enormous flocks of squid.  Then jellyfish?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Normally, I'd say no.  Everything's quiet now -- no ships, no divers, no electricity.  Makes sense.  But what's curious is -- these aren't normal jellyfish.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What do you mean -- not normal?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: They have six tentacles.  A new species.  And the squid too.  They had no stomach.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wait a minute.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You knew about the squid not being normal.  Before Fletcher went out there?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yeah, why?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: And you didn't tell anyone?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What?  Why...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I mean, I'm not... I wasn't absolutely sure if... they --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: They are or they aren't.  Which is it?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What?...  Wait.  Don't... why are you --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Nobody said... Norman...  What?  Why are you looking at me like that?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I didn't do anything wrong.  I didn't mean...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I can't feel her bones.  She's like a sponge.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: She was crushed.  Feel her skin -- it's like sandpaper.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What could have done this?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Eggs.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: ... He lied to us.  He left us down here.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: C'mon, Beth.  Don't make this personal.  He told me himself they were taking us back.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yeah, he <u>told</u> you.  Think.  What was Barnes doing before they cut that cable loose?  He was on the phone. Except that cable is a thousand feet long, Norman.  They would've broken off communication with us four, five minutes before they cleared out.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: So who was Barnes talking to at the last minute?  Nobody.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You're jumping to conclusions, Beth. Don't get worked up --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Fuck you, Norman!  It's right here...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: "Although advised of risks, all personnel elect to remain down for duration of storm to continue investigation of alien sphere and associated spacecraft.  Signed, Barnes, USN."

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Where did you get this?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: In Edmunds' things.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You went through Edmunds' things?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: He's not just a Navy captain -- he works for the fucking Pentagon.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Calm down, Beth.  Alright?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't tell me to calm down!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's done, alright?  It's over!  And there's not a damn thing we can do about it now, okay?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You said something to him, didn't you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You told him about me?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You did, didn't you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Don't do this.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You bastard.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth, I didn't.  Hold it together. Alright?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yeah, okay.  Sure, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No, I should stay calm.  Like you say.  Right, Norman?  Stay calm.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Where are you going in such a hurry?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I have to reset the sub.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Forget the sub.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't bother me, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's not worth the risk.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's also our only way out of here! It holds three people.  And there's only three of us left now.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You, me and Harry?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You, me and Harry.  He's asleep.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wake him, then.  Let's go.  Get outta --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: We can't.  The storm.  The waves would toss us around worse than we got down here.  And we have four days of decompression when we get up top.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Four days?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Get the helium out of our bloodstream.  We go to the surface now, we'd pop like a soda bottle.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Maybe you should go.  To the sub.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Why should I go?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You should know how it works.  Just in case.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: In case you die, too?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I don't trust Harry to do it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I would.  But my suit --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I fixed your suit.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You fixed my suit?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You don't trust me?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But I don't know how --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You press a button, Norman.  It's not brain surgery.  Here, go ahead.  You only have 15 minutes to reset it.  Go on, Norman...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: The sub's a 100 feet in front of you.  You see it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I can't see anything.  How does it look?  Still clear?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Still clear.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You fixed this suit?  Beth?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yes, Norman.  I did.  You're just nervous.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: My air isn't... I'm coming back.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You can't.  Counter's at 10 minutes. You don't have time.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Still clear?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Still clear.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: ... what do you mean?  I'm in the ship.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What are you doing in the ship?  Beth?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Getting food.  We were out of food. what's wrong?  You sound mad.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yeah, well, I get that way when I'm facing death and someone deserts me.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Deserts you?  Harry said he'd take over for me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He what?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You get it straightened out?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I think so, Beth.  Yes.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What's Harry doing with your suit in there?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Fixing it.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Fixing it?  But I fixed --  Where'd you get all that?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The refridgerator.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: The refridgerator.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's a pretty common place to look for food when you don't think you have any.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: That wasn't in there before.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We must've had it delivered then.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Wait a second --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: 1-800-Deepsea delivery.  I hear they're good.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: None of this was here before.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Did you look?  It was on the top shelf.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No, it wasn't.  I swear none of this was here.  None of it.  You think he hid it?  Earlier.  He must've hid it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You don't believe me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: All I know is I opened that refridgerator --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Damn it, Norman.  I swear.  I had a whole conversation with the man when he woke up.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: This being after you so carefully fixed my suit.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You think it's me?  You think I'm saying there was a conversation when there wasn't?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't know, Beth.  I wasn't there.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Damn it, Norman!  He's lying.  Don't you get it?  There is something seriously fucked up going on here -- and he's causing it.  Why can't you believe me?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Page 87.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Page 87.  "I could never read that far."

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: "Our fisherman frequently see some that are more than four feet long. Some skeletons of squids...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Squids?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: "... according to calculations of some naturalists, one of these animals, only six feet long, would have tentacles 27 feet long.  That would make a formidable monster."

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: After the attack, a Navy guy woke me up -- I don't know -- I thought he was an illusion.  But I checked the tape, and Jerry said he manifested him.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Manifested?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Created.  Brought to life.  I don't know.  But at the end, Jerry said, "Stop calling me Jerry".  And --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He translated it wrong.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Remember when we first spoke to Jerry, Barnes kept asking for Jerry's real name?  But Harry never would?  He didn't because he was afraid the screen would say "Harry", instead of Jerry.  We weren't talking to an alien intelligence when we talked to Jerry, we were talking to Harry... or a part of Harry.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What do you mean, a part of Harry?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: When did the messages start?  The animals outside start showing up? After Harry came out of the sphere.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You think, in the sphere --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He acquired some sort of power.  A power to manifest things.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: But how?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How can the sphere do that?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't know, Beth.  I'm not the fucking alien that built the thing. But it can.  When Harry came out of the sphere, he mumbled something about page 87.  How he would never read that far -- he was too scared to.  Then you found the book, remember in your lab.  Then in the cafeteria -- and page 87 talks about a giant squid...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Which I told Barnes was attacking --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's his fear.  The squid.  He's manifesting his fears.  Making them real.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: But why is he doing it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He must not realize he is.  Like the Navy crewman -- Harry was sleeping then.  He must've manifested his dream.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: His dream?  You can't control your dreams.  And you can't control your fears, can you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No.  I mean, we've always believed we can think anything we want without consequences.  You ever read the Bible?  It talks about our sinful nature, you know?  I mean, we can think, and believe, and desire whatever we want, but there's a part of us -- a shadow side, as Jung called it -- that can't be controlled.  It's evil. It's inside us.  It's what we are.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: And that's the part of Harry that's being manifested.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Must be.  And if it is -- it's a part of him not even he can control.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Looks like some sort of code.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Why would Harry go back to using a code?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Diphenyl parlene.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Something for burns.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Ephedrine hydrochloride.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's for motion sickness.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Valdomet.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Ulcers.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Sintag.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: A synthetic opium analogue.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Does it cause drowsiness?  That's all we need.  To get him unconscious -- put him under.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Nothing about drowsiness.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Tarazine?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Tranquilizer.  Causes drowsiness.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Bingo.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: "... and may also cause bizarre halucinations".

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Riordan?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Antihistamine.  For bites.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Damn it!  Chloramphenicol?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Antibiotic.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Parasolutrine?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How do you spell it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: P-a-r-a-s-o...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's a soporific.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Causes sleep.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's like a sleeping pill?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: "... used as an anesthetic if given in combination with paracin trichloride... "

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: "20 cc's of parasolutrine in combination with 6 cc's of paracin given IV produces deep sleep suitable for emergency surgical procedures... no cardiac side effects ... REM activity is surpressed... "

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How long does it last?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Three to six hours.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I'll just boost the doses.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What?  Wait -- isn't that dangerous?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How fast does it take effect?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Doesn't say.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What if it takes 20 minutes, Norman? What if it takes an hour?  And he can fight it off?  We can't afford that.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's an idea.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: To be on the safe side.  I mean --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You want to kill him?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Look, it's either him or us, Norman. Another attack, and we go down with this place.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You ever given an injection before.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Thirty years ago.  In residency.  I passed out.  You?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Only lab rats.  Here.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Not believing you.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You're not sorry.  You're scared.  You're a psychologist, Norman.  You pride yourself on knowing when someone's lying to you, not telling you the truth.  And now you're scared ... because you're not sure you can tell anymore.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What is it, Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: In the sub.  Resetting the timer. Why?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The sphere looks different.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What do you mean, different?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The grooves around the door -- they've shifted.  And the pattern -- the fluids -- they look darker now.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How's Harry?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What was that?  I couldn't hear you.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Your watch.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Oh yes, my watch.  I almost forgot.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What's wrong, Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm feeling better.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's getting cold.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You think I'd really drink that?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You don't think I put something in it, do you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You put explosives around the habitat, I can't imagine what you'd put in a drink.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I did do that, didn't I?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: How do you feel about snakes?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Snakes?  What do you mean, exactly?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You know what I mean.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Am I afraid of them?  Not during the day.  Sea snakes are diurnal.  When the sun's out, they don't bite. Fortunately for you, I had on my watch.  This is quite good.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What are they doing down here?  In the bathroom?  Suddenly appearing.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You tell me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Do you fear them?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Are you manifesting them?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: If I was, then I would've had to have gone in the sphere, wouldn't I?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What's the phrase -- "keeping up with the Joneses"?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Why did you go in the sphere, Beth?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Same reason I put explosives around the habitat.  For defense.  For the power.  To protect myself.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Against what?  Harry's unconscious. He's not a threat.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No, he isn't.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He can't manifest.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No, he can't.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Then why, Beth?  Why go in?  Why put out explosives?  Why manifest the snakes?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You think I manifested the snakes?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Someone did.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yes, someone did.  But it wasn't me, Norman.  It was you.  You manifested the snakes.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth you're losing it.  C'mon.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: C'mon -- what?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You're lying --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Am I lying?  Are you sure?  Are you absolutely sure I'm lying?  Then explain to me about the jellyfish.  Earlier.  Why did we see jellyfish?  Harry doesn't fear jellyfish.  You do.  They're your fear, aren't they?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: And the snakes?  You want to know about the snakes?  You saw one outside earlier, didn't you?  When you thought I had deserted you -- you were terrified.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That's when you went in the sphere.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: One lonely, terrifying sea snake.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You manifested that, Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Did I?  Or was that you?  When you were hiding in the bathroom -- all conspiratorially like you were -- you became frightened, didn't you?  Terrified.  Like you were with the snake earlier -- and suddenly you have snakes slithering all over the floor.  You did that, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You're insane.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Am I?  Or am I making so much sense that you're going insane?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I never went in that sphere.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You don't remember you did.  But I'm sure you remember running like some fucking hero to get Harry, don't you?  You remember that.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You remember before you picked him up -- when you looked up at the sphere, you remember that -- when the sphere opened?  That's right.  But you can't remember going inside, can you?  No, of course not.  Harry couldn't either, could he?  "Like everything's on the tip of my tongue", he said.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That's bullshit.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth, the message said Harry.  "My name is Harry".  My name isn't Harry.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No, it isn't.  Your name is Norman. But your younger brother -- what was his name?  The one who was stung when you were younger.  The one that died. The one you couldn't save.  What was his name?  "Mommy, we're going out to the ocean -- to go swimming." "But I don't want to go swimming, Norman.  I'm scared." "C'mon, <u>Harry</u>, it'll be fine, it'll be fun."  You heartless fuck.  That's why you're so scared of the water, isn't it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Shut up, Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: When you were in that sub -- and that squid was attacking you -- are you sure it was the squid that was attacking?  Do you know?  "I can't get Beth on the radio.  I'm in this tiny sub on the bottom of the fucking ocean.  All alone.  Surrounded by all this water." Was it really the squid that was attacking you, Norman -- or was it something else -- one of your fears?  You never really saw what it was, did you?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I'm not scaring you, am I Norman?  I hope I'm not frightening you.  The last thing I want to do is frighten you.  You feel okay, don't you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's not me, Beth.  I swear.  It can't be.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: "It's not me, Beth.  It's not me.  It can't be.  I'm not doing anything." Just like Harry said before I stabbed him with the needle.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Don't, Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: But I have to, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I promise --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Promise what, Norman?  Tell me!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You think I'd belive you?  Believe anything you might say now?  After you lied to me about telling Barnes about my past.  About my problems.  My problems.  Not yours.  Not his.  Mine.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Don't, Beth.  Please.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's either this... or I kill you.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's your choice.  Because it's not safe for you to be awake.  To be walking around.  To be thinking about things.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's not safe for you to be either.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You think I care?  You think I care if I die?  Would I put explosives around the habitat -- set on vibration sensors -- that can trigger automatically, if I cared about myself?  Would I? I've tried twice before, Norman, why wouldn't I try a third time?  I'm not thinking about myself -- No, Norman, I'm thinking about you.  Your safety. Protecting you from your own self.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: This is what I'm talking about, Norman.  Don't you see?  It's in you. This vindictiveness.  This rage.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Get away from the door, Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Of course you're going to deny it. You want to blame someone else.  You want to blame Beth.  Because you hate Beth.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Don't fuck with me, Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I'm not fucking with you, Norman. You've fucked yourself.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You're frightened, aren't you, Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Where is it coming from, Beth?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't you know?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth, stop it!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Stop what?  Don't blame me.  It's not me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Then where's it coming from?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: From you, Norman.  From your mind. You're doing it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's you, Norman.  Your fear of drowning.  You have to face it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Leave me alone, Norman.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You can't stop it, Norman.  You can't fight me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I know.  You're too strong, Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Oh please, don't shrink me, Norman. Not now.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't tell me about me.  I already know too much.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth -- gimme the gun.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Oh, sure.  Here.  Anything else, Beth can get you?  Some more chicken, perhaps.  Let Beth check the fridge.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: C'mon --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Top shelf, is it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Let's get out of here, Beth.  Let's go home.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What is that?  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You hear that?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Hear what?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Get away from me!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Get away --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Would it work?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yes.  And I think we already know it will.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Down below, Harry said we would all have to die.  Since there was no evidence on that spacecraft that anybody knew time travel through a black hole was possible -- and we all knew -- then we would all have to die before we could tell anyone. Death was the only logical explanation.  But sitting here, we still know.  So how is that possible?  Unless we make ourselves forget.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Pussy.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What's that -- mistake number two, Norman?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: No.  I don't think so.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Well, think.  Because there's footprints here that aren't mine.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Well, they're not mine.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: It doesn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Well, what's your theory?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I'm a woman.  I don't theorize.  I only deal with facts.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Norman?  Where's Norman?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: By the bunks.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: He doesn't wait for an answer.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Who says it's a he?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Pry the thing open?  What are we -- neanderthals?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: All that banging and pounding.  I don't know.  We should think about making a good first impression.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: For who?  The fish?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: For whoever's in that thing.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: It's empty.  Why would someone build a ship like this?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You'd have to ask them.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Then what is it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's an American spacecraft.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What are you looking for?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A light switch.  A button opened that door -- the craft runs on some sort of power.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Take politics, our views on abortion, the death penalty...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Cannibalism, to be extreme.  And now we're talking about a new life form. Their values and ethics may be incomprehensible.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: When he woke up, he said we were out of food.  He told me to get some from the ship.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I never said that.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yes you did.  Norman, I wouldn't leave you out there.  You know that.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We never even had a conversation, Norman.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Harry?  That's bullshit.  We stood right there --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Jerry.  Right.  I said Jerry, didn't I?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's a hell of a mistake to make, Beth.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Slip of the tongue.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, I don't know how you could make that confusion.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Just in time, too.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: In time for what?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just in time for what?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Our habitat, I mean.  This place can't handle another attack.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Another attack?
